intro: Registaniella, commonly known as the Mediterranean bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to southern Europe and North Africa. Registaniella has slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal and dry climates.
